questions.question_text: What is the best way to limit the exponential growth of Breakdown element scores?

discussion.content:
The best way to limit the exponential growth of Breakdown element scores is:

B. By unchecking the “Collect breakdown matrix” property of an indicator

When this property is unchecked, the system does not collect the scores for every possible combination of breakdown elements, which can significantly reduce the number of scores stored and help manage the growth of the database. This can be particularly important for instances with a large number of breakdown elements.

An Indicator Source is used in data collection to:

A. Collect all the matching records into a temporary result set.

Indicator Sources define the set of records to evaluate and how to evaluate them when collecting data for Performance Analytics. They act as the basis for indicator score calculations by identifying the records from the facts table that match the defined conditions at the time of the data collection.
